Posts.Content: That is the way we look at it. You don't have to worry about ED if you are dead. My hubby and I are happy with our choice.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: ED Meds Cost (Cialis)

Posts.Content: The cost is too high. My hubby is just not taking it. They wanted $191/month. We have been using the vacuum pump but the Cialis is supposed to help in things other then ED. The company will give you a one month supply for free if you go to there website and print out the coupon. My hubby felt that the Cialis didn't improve things enough if at all. I am just happy to have my hubby.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Posts.Title: Struggling After Surgery

Posts.Content: Last Monday we were told that my 57 year old husband has prostate cancer. It is supposedly in the low to moderate risk category. He hasn't recovered from the biopsy 2 weeks ago yet. He has considerable discomfort. The nurse did not seem impressed. I think that is why I started reading the forum. He is scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29. Just getting used to the idea of cancer.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: I am a wife whose husband has just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: He wants it out. His PSA was rising and his father's prostate cancer was found to late. On three sides longevity is the norm. His father's male line less so. He has dealt with prostate issues since his late 20's. Saw a urologist a few years ago who said he had an enlarged prostate. We picked a different urologist who treats my dad's kidney cancer. I have been very impressed with my dad's treatment and hope my husbands is as good. I am a bit confused on the nerve sparing. We have another appointment with the doc to talk about things in late March. I at least need time to digest this. My husband has been throwing himself into his research.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Posts.Title: I am a wife whose husband has just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: Today my hubby had his prostate removed. It took about 4 hours with the robot. He seems pretty good. He is reading and waiting for his clear liquid tray. The doctor came out beaming. He was able to spare the nerves on one side. That was the best that we could hope for because of the position of the cancer. Hopefully now things will be better.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: Hubby is on the other side of surgery!

Posts.Content: Thank you for all your good wishes. First time up he was like an energizer bunny.... Stayed up for over an hour with 2 walks. Second time up not so good..... He did take a shower though. I am wondering if they will send him home today. He seems to healthy to be here. I did tell him that I was going to sleep at home tonight. He seems OK with that. Eventually I have to go and see to the cats. The dog is elsewhere while he is in the hospital..... My friends are starting with food and we are still in the hospital. I will meet my friend at the house if necessary. These are good problems to have. The doc is as positive as possible without the path report being back.

Posts.Title: I am a wife whose husband has just been diagnosed

Posts.Content: I think it is time to take this very seriously. I am not a doc but I think the time for watchful waiting is past. There is always some risk with any procedure but the psa scores are indicating something is not right. I personally do not feel that alternative medicines or diets can CURE cancer. It might slow it down but.... You know you have cancer. It was seen in all 15 core samples.... Just my humble opinion.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.

Posts.Title: Prostate Biospys safe?

Posts.Content: Even though their as some positive margins it does not mean your goose is cooked. There still is several treatment options. Good luck we are new to this too. My hubby is 57 and just had his biopsy results back. We are in that in-between time between biopsy and removal...
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Posts.Title: New to site one month post surgery

Posts.Content: I am also the wife of a prostate cancer husband. We are waiting for the surgery. The path report sounds mostly encouraging. Prostate cancer is much more slow growing then breast cancer. If she has clear margins you are likely done. My hubby sees the robot on 4/29.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: Wife of Newly Diagnosed--what do I need to know about this info?

Posts.Content: Hubby had DaVinci on April 30.... He is doing very well... The cancer was a gleason 3, 3 nearing bad areas.... He still gets tired, he still leaks and sex is sort of non existent. We are OK with all this and hope that things get better. We are best friends who have been married 30 years. Lots of cuddling. The doc proscribed Cialis at 5 mg once a day and a vacuum pump for the in words. Hubby and I are more worried about the leaks then the other problem (in an ideal world both will get better). First the insurance denied the pills completely. Then the doc tried for preauthorization and the insurance will pay for 6 5 mg pills per month. This is not a sex dose. and will not work for either problem so we are still fighting the insurance. I was wondering if he cant get the 30 would 6 pills at 20 mg every 5 days do the same thing with benefits.... The pills are $191/month. I found a voucher for a 30 day free sample. So at least we will have an idea if the expense is worth it if we lose to the insurance company. The vacuum pump is a non starter with the insurance but is a one time event. It is getting very frustrating dealing with them. THis stuff is supposed to help with the incontinence (which is getting better. What is experience with the insurance?
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: The in words.... impotence and incontinince .... and insurance....

Posts.Content: I think the staging is T1b but I am not clear. The doc said that overall the incontinence rate is 7% but when he preforms the surgery it is 2%. I am pretty confident but my hubby does not want to seek a second opinion or leave Boise for the surgery. He has time off from classes but is hoping to grade (but not give) his own finals. I am very grateful he was not planning to teach this summer.
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: Questions for the doc.... Before surgery....

Posts.Content: Tomorrow we see the urologist. I wanted to talk about nerve sparing robotic.. I am hoping he can make the call during surgery. My reading indicate it helps with continence and to a lesser extent sex. I think I should also figure out what we need to have in the home. I am wondering if any of you have questions that we should ask the doc. Things you wish you had before the surgery. Hubby doesn't seem to want to be on the forums. The discomfort from the biopsy finally cleared towards the end of the week Thanks!
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
Posts.Title: Questions for the doc.... Before surgery....

Posts.Content: We talked to the doc about the procedure and about nerve sparing. Apparently the problem is near the apex where the prostate narrows like a beat. He is positive he can't spare the left side but there is a possibility that he can spare the right. We also asked him for a prescription for problems we were having before the diagnosis. Now we can play for a month before the problems start. I don't embarrass easily but the way hubby phrased it made it sound like it was all my idea.... The doc put at ease and gave us some samples. Maybe he wants to know what worked best before the surgery too. I am feeling very confident with the doctor and the treatment plan. Now here is hoping that after the operation we will have seen the last of the cancer....
Posts.Signature: Husband,57, has just been diagnosed. 3 cores positive for cancer gleason 3,3,6 in right side. Neoplasia in one core on the left. He isn't into forums but I am. Need to learn a lot quickly. Spent last night reading the forum and found it helpful. Scheduled for robotic prostate removal on April 29, 2014. His dad died of prostate cancer.
